The office just felt old and tired. From previous experience, Americas best offices are usually more modern and updated.  This one was not.

First off (and I'm not necessarily complaining about this...I AM giving this place 4 stars after all), how many people were enticed by the free eye exam w/2 frames for $69.99 deal? Everyone. And how many people ACTUALLY paid that (plus tax)? Nobody. That's what I thought. 

Like I said, I'm not complaining because I knew I wanted one of my frames to be made into sunglasses which costs more, but this place does find other ways to nickel & dime you as well. They will talk you in to paying an extra $15 with your eye exam to get tested for glaucoma. I hadn't had an eye exam in 4 years so I went ahead and did this. I have to say, the optometrist who did my exam (as well as the assistant) were very nice. I actually realized when I pulled up to the building I had an eye exam here like 7-8 years ago. They still had my information on file & funny enough, the same optometrist from back then examined me this time (I recognized him & he mentioned it was definitely his hand writing in my file).  

The woman who helped me with my frames was nice as well. I mean, yeah, she tried to talk to me into an upgrade here & one there, but I immediately told her I wanted one of my frames to be sunglasses so I think she was a little less aggressive on that front knowing I was gonna spend more than the "standard" deal right off the bat. I STILL thought I had paid too much for everything, but when I got home I called around to compare (yeah, I'm THAT person) & realized that getting RX sunglasses really does cost a lot of $$$ and I probably didn't pay anymore here than I would have at other places (including Walmart & Costco) for all that I got. 

I went to pick up my frames today and was VERY happy. I actually called them to see if they were possibly ready a little earlier than expected (I really wanted/needed my new sunglasses), and sure enough they were!

At the end of the day I'm not sure if the savings here is as great as it might first appear, but I certainly don't think you get ripped off. And for the service & quality of the frames I would definitely recommend America's Best...at least this location

I had a wonderful experience. I brought my mom in because I knew she needed an exam. When we came in the girls at the front desk, Shelby and Tiffany, were very nice and helpful. They got me all of the answers I needed and were happy to do so. I filled out my moms medical history form and helped her look for frames while the girls finished her paperwork.

Mom found 3 frames that she loved, but one was a "green tag" frame, we later found out it would only cost $10 more for that pair! So she chose a blue and green tag.

Before we knew it Tiffany called her to go back and run tests. I asked if it would be ok if I came with and she told me of course and had a very pleasant attitude. She explained the importance of coming in yearly for exams, but I didn't feel she was pushy, just that she was concerned that she hadn't had an exam before. We opted to do the extra $15 test to check for any damage.

We then went to see the doctor, Dr. Cheney, he was very nice and explained everything so clearly. We felt comfortable and informed about my mother's vision. She has some sun damage and needed bifocals.

We went out to wait and be seen by the next girl to order the glasses. We knew it wouldn't be the $69.95 deal that was advertised due to needing bifocals.

Monica helped us in the end. This was our first time getting glasses, so we had no idea what to do. She was happy we had already picked frames out and told my mom they looked great on her. She explained the different packages and told us if we wanted to do the $69.95 deal she would have to switch between driving glasses and reading glasses and she recommended getting the bifocals. In the end we agreed. Mom wanted the no line because she hates the idea of growing old haha. So Monica again went over the different no line bifocal options. 
It was nearing the end of the day now and they were closing soon. Another woman interrupted to tell us they were closing and we needed to finish soon. I found it very rude, especially since we had already chosen our frames and were simply trying to make sure we were informed on our options. She seemed annoyed that we were taking longer than she wanted. We still made sure we ordered what we wanted and even got to make one pair a sunglass.

We picked up her glasses and she is very happy with them. It is taking some getting used to, but she can see comfortably now.

Overall a great experience and I will recomend to anyone. Just try and go earlier in the day to not feel rushed.

I had mentioned to my boyfriend that I needed to renew my eyeglass prescription, and he mentioned the deal America's best had where you can get an eye exam and 2 pairs of glasses including the lenses for $69.99. I needed contacts as well and when I called the store, I specifically asked if there was a way to get both the eyeglass and contact lens exam for an additional cost. The woman on the phone told me for $79.99 I could have both the eyeglass exam and contact lens exam, so just $10 more. 

I made an appointment and saw the doctor as usual, discussed my options for both glasses and contacts and then proceeded to pick out 2 frames to go along with the deal I had called about. UGH! Turns out after sitting down to finalize everything that the contact lens exam was BY ITSELF $79.99 and there were no glasses or anything included! The staff apologized for the miscommunication, but at that point I had both called to get the correct information and ended up spending a good hour and a half in the store picking out frames. In the end, the manager gave me $10 off. I walked out of there with a pair of glasses I paid for separately from the $79.99 contact lens exam I apparently paid for. No glasses, frames, or anything included that the deal AND STAFF mentioned over the phone. 

Additionally, the staff were pushy and a little on the rude side. To their benefit, the gentleman that helped us tried to be sympathetic towards the issue. Overall I would not recommend this place. The prices are ok, be aware that glasses take a couple weeks to get as they don't have their own optical lab. I'll be going somewhere different in the future when I want a new pair.

I was a customer of this particular location from the early 90s up until about 5 years ago. I quit going because of the deplorable customer service and attitude from several of the staff. The customer service just deteriorated year after year and I finally had enough. But about a year and a half ago I got a discount offer in the mail from them and decided to give them another try. I was pleasantly surprised. I went for an eye exam and the customer service was an improvement. The glasses and contacts were a painless process this time around. When I went back for a yearly exam a few months ago, I didn't have any issues with them. 
I hope the good customer service continues.

I purchased the Eyecare Club Membership back in January 2013 and only used it then.  I recently found my receipt and realized it didn't expire until 2016, so I made an appointment online.  Very easy and quick to set-up an appointment on their website, it even sends you a google calender reminder to confirm.  Went to the appointment and everyone upfront was extremely friendly.  It was busy so I expected to wait, but to my surprise it did not exceed ten minutes and I was able to update my information and fill out other paperwork.  When I was called in to do the preliminary eye check, I was also attended a very courteous manner. The doctor was also extremely helpful, during the eye exam he explained the process he was performing to determine my prescription.  He showed me my current prescription and my new prescription, there was a significant difference, I was excited to get new pair of glasses and contacts. This is where the the attentive and polite attention stopped.

I was called over to a sales person, I was quickly asked if I was interested in buying glasses or contacts.  I responded that I was interested in buying both and that I saw some frames online.  I gave her the model numbers and sku numbers, but she seemed annoyed when I didn't have pictures of what the glasses looked like.  I tried to hunt for them on the racks, but I assumed they could pull up the models on their computers with sku number or brand name/model number.  We finally found the two that I was most interested in and asked if I could get a quote on the price without insurance and insurance (since they are considered out of network and the coverage is considerably less than in-network). It sounded like I had asked her to do the most gruesome and tedious task and she only gave me the quote with insurance.  It sounded like there was not much of a discount, so I decided to pass on the glasses and asked for a box of contacts.  I had not worn their brand of contacts since 2013 and with a new prescription, I wasn't sure how they would fit.  I asked her if I purchased a box and they were not comfortable, if I could return them or exchange them.  She answered annoyed that once they were open I couldn't do either.  So I asked her for some options, because I didn't want to get stuck with contacts that I would not wear if they didn't fit properly.  I had not worn their brand since 2013 and I don't remember the reason I didn't purchase from them.  She became really agitated and replied, "We can't just give you free stuff.  You can't just come in here and not buy stuff and ask for free things."  At this point I had not asked for anything free, nor had I mentioned sample contacts.  I just wanted to know that if I purchased contacts and I was not satisfied, I would be able to exchange them or return them.  I told her I didn't want the contacts either and that I just wanted my prescription.  She threw them on the table and replied that the 2013 prescription was also there.  I mentioned that I didn't need the 2013 and she replied by saying, "I don't care what you do with it."  I felt extremely disrespected and left, I thanked her for the prescription and she smugly replied, "Have a grrreat day."

I was not asking for a free hand out or free sample, I just wanted to know that if I was buying and not satisfied I could exchange it.  The doctor even told me during my eye exam to let him know if that brand of contacts would work, and if it didn't to come back in so they could find one that did.  He even asked that I come back in for a follow up appointment with my new prescription to make sure my depth perception was accurate, as it looked a little off from the other tests.  I regret that I will not be going back, instead having to use my VSP insurance to find an in network doctor to do these additional tests.

Staff is friendly but the wait was too long. I made an appointment and was 15 min early for that appointment; however, they took all the walk-ins in the waiting room in ahead of me. I think an appointment should trump a walk-in, but that's just me! I did mention it to staff because I was trying to make it to work on time and they were super sympathetic and apologetic about it.

I have nothing but good things to say about Indian Springs Village. The office staff are helpful and always friendly. Maintenance requests are usually fulfilled within a day or two. I really don't have any complaints at all. The grounds are kept spotless, landscaping is well-groomed and all-in-all a very reasonable place to live. I looked at many, many apartments and the monthly rent is much lower here than most places. I love the location as well. Right here in the heart of the city yet in a quiet neighborhood just off of Alma School. I really don't put much faith in all of the negative comments. Sometimes people that have a chip on their shoulders about particular complexes, have issues of their own....especially if they're asked to leave (for good reason), pay their rent on time, etc. So, I really don't put much bearing on any of these negative comments. Consider the source. Indian Springs Village:  I give them an A+!

As a kid I enjoyed it when I traveled out West, but I have come to realize more and more over the years that the food here is truly disgusting.

This was the last location I visited and will probably be my last visit to a Jack in the Box in a long time. Even for fast food I just can't stomach it.

I receive text messages from sonic with promotions re: new items , specials of the day etc.

I was in the mood for a sundae and went to grab one for me
And a friend of mine.  When I mentioned the special price they said they werent 
Offering that price. Once I explained it was a text/club prIce they asked me to pull forward.

After all 4 employees looked at my text message and they had their little pow wow they decided to give me the price.

When they handed me my sundaes, honest to God they basically took one sundae and split it into two! 

So they scammed me but whatever !

I will Think twice about this location the next time I want to make an ice cream run!

I mean
Come on, even at half price sonic your not losing and dinero dayum

This is the worst sonic I have been to.  The service is slow, the food is bad - buns that are half frozen, cheese sticks ice cold and barely cook french fries - more than 1 time.  You would think I would learn and give up, but no I keep hoping they will get better.  This week was the last try - they had no ice.  How is that possible in AZ in the summer.  I am done.

If I could give less than 1 star I would. I only got a medium strawberry limeade. Had maybe 5 baby sips because it tasted horrible. Dumped it all out and found lettuce in it. I'm never coming back here again.

One word for this place - NASTY.    Worst hamburgers in Mesa period!!!!!  In fact just about all Sonics are this way today.   What happened to the Sonic we used to know, when the burgers were big, fresh, and hot.   Back then, the fries were great, and the value and selection were good too.  Today - NASTY.   If all of the Sonics in Arizona are franchised by one person, heed this warning.   Either improve your food, or you will be out of business and alot of people out of work.   I've already complained to corporate once, and the next call I make will be the CEO of Sonic.  That's assuming waste my money at another Sonic.   Regardless, he needs to hear just how bad this Sonic and others in Arizona have become.

When it is over 110' in AZ and I am a cranky and sweaty mess, a fountain drink with pebble ice in a styrofoam cup is at the top of my list of needs. 

I was shocked to see the low stars for this Sonic location. I mean, yes it is Sonic and the food is pretty terrible, but the drinks?! You just can't beat em! 

And this location had super fast service and our car hops were very friendly! I was impressed! 

Route 44 Diet Coke with lime for life!
This is a great hole in the wall shop off of Val Vista Rd. I've been getting the chicken salad sandwich since 2006 and it's the same ever since GREAT! Cookies and bread are awesome as well...
love this place!

This review is for their propane exchange and overall customer service. Over the past year, their propane exchange kiosk has only worked once. The standard procedure is to go to the outside machine, see if it works, verify that it doesn't and then go stand in line to pay for a propane exchange. Afterwards, a 5 - 10 minute wait follows for someone to come to the front of the store and unlock the propane cage. Tonight, after going through the first several steps and purchasing my propane I was told, " Sir - it probably doesn't work because all of the propane tanks are empty." This is after waiting a few minutes. I went back outside to verify that there are in fact propane tanks and I am now 8 minutes into my wait for a tank. The experience overall is incredibly frustrating and so much so that I no longer wish to give this location one penny of my money for any purchase period.

Its Home Depot. You've got questions, they have answers. Not always the best 1's but they will give you answer. Necessary evils in the game of life. Clean location, questionable PDSS employees but most of all I gotta say thanks for the Military Discount

Our 1960s-era house needed new windows.  And I was seriously dreading the process, as my experience with window salesman has been less-than-stellar.  In fact, I once threatened to call the police on a window salesman who wouldn't leave.  So my husband and I worked up a game plan:  we'd tell the Home Depot sales person we wanted him to take measurements then email us an estimate.  No high-pressure sales would be tolerated.  

Instead of high-pressure, we had courteous, professional, and efficient Joe.  Joe rocked.  He took measurements, asked us what we were looking for (vinyl-clad, mid-range price).  He had the estimate for us in a few minutes.  To my shock, it was half the price of what the trespasser estimated.  And no BS about "sign in your yard" discounts, "if you say yes right now" discounts, nor any other tomfoolery.  Yes, I said tomfoolery.  It's a good word that's not used nearly enough.  

So if you need windows, contact HD and try out their no-pressure sales.

I bought a 3 gallon container with a little nozzle for my desk. When they sold it to my they said it was rare that the nozzle leaked but to tighten it if it did and it should be okay. She tightened it and filled it with water. I got home and left it on the counter. I later realized that it was leaking a lot so I tilted it in the other direction only for it to leak too. So I emptied the remaining water and took it back the very next day. They called their supervisor Lauren and asked if they could exchange it. She said that all they could do was to try and tighten it for but they would not exchange it for one that didn't have a nozzle. I paid 15 dollars for this water container and it didn't function properly. I will never come back here and urge everyone not to purchase any water containers here. This is not a way to treat customers.  I could understand if I had it for an extended period of time but it literally didn't do what it was supposed to do.

I wish I could give zero stars. I honestly don't know which is worse... 1) The water quality. 2) the customer service (or lack thereof). 3) the cleanliness. 4) water bottles. I purchased and filled a 1.5 gallon jug. I took it home and when I got the bottle  out of my car, I noticed a small puddle. I thought that maybe the nozzle needed to be tightened but it didn't stop the leaking. I transferred the water to a pitcher and took the jug back on the same day and they said no refunds or exchanges! What a ripoff. I was even more upset when I went home and drank the water and it tasted like it came straight from the faucet. I will never return and encourage people to do the same.

While on a business trip last week, my lower molar started aching uncontrollably with sharp pain. After calling my regular dentist, he recommended seeing an Endodontist immediately informing me I had a dying nerve and the pain would only increase.

After looking here on Yelp, I called Red Mountain, and to my surprise, they were able to see me WITHIN THE HOUR!

Their office decor was extremely professional and looked like something right out of Architecture Digest. After being greeted and welcomed, rather than the employee handing me a clipboard with pages to full out, I was lead to a private room with touchscreen computers and I experienced my first ALL DIGITAL paperwork, including digital signature! I wish EVERY place had this!

Dr. Frost and the technician Ashley carefully explained in simple terms everything that was going on with my dying nerve and the root canal procedure they were about to perform.

After a little anesthetic and about 90 minutes of Dr. Frost's careful dentistry, I was on my way with no more pain!

RECOMMENDED!

I was really impressed with this place! My husband received a referral for a root canal, and I trusted the yelp reviews when trying to find a specialist - THEY WERE SPOT ON!  Red Mountain was able to get my husabnd in quickly, and when he arrived for is appointment, he was very impressed with his entire experience. The front office staff were professional and friendly, the office was modern with the latest technology, and Dr. Hamberlin did an amazing job. The practice let us know upfront what our costs would be, so there were no surprises. We were even looking for a new dentist and they gave us a great referral. We would highly recommend Red Mountain for your endodontic needs!

My family and I are very grateful to have Dr. James Hamberlin  as an endodontist.
The office is always clean, the staff is very pleasant and helpful. I was able to get in quickly for a root canal. Dr Hamberlin explains what the problem is and how he will treat it and what the results should be. He is very articulate and a good listener. Which puts one at ease. Very nice, relaxed atmosphere, what you need when you are looking at dental treatment. Thank you Dr. Hamberlin and staff  :) 

PS  My root canal went very well!

Saw Dr. Richardson on 8/23/13 - I was experiencing some sensitivity in the tooth he did a root canal on two months ago, and was concerned that there might be a problem.  

The staff was able to get me in right away, and although Dr. Richardson was very busy, he took the time to COMPLETELY evaluate my situation, and reassure me that everything was fine.

I cannot say enough about this business, and about Dr. Richardson.  I have seen both offices, and everything is TOP NOTCH in my book.  They deserve SIX stars, but yelp only allows five, so that is what they get!

5/5 - 100% satisfaction - HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!!

Dr Richardson is awesome! He is gentle, kind and patient. He thoroughly answered all my questions so that i can clearly understand my procedure. He eased any nervousness i had and his staff is very kind and helpful as well! I especially like his nice Queen Creek location.
I definitely would recommend him! 
Sincerely one happy patient,

Keilah C

My 10yr old was having tooth pains starting Sunday  so I schedule him for an appointment with his regular  dentist. My husband took him and they were told he needs to see a specialist today. 

They schedule us here and I can tell you immediately Jonelle (maybe I'm spelling her name wrong) at the front desk was very pleasant and understanding. She talked to my little guy and answer his million questions he had about what will happen next I thought that was nice and patient of her. I have to say the check in went very smoothly and quickly, I went into a another room and filled out everything electronically on the computer and that was it.

We saw Dr. Hamberlin. He was also very patient and understanding answering my little guys questions. My son was nervous and in pain already he was worried about needles and feeling more pain. A root canal will need to be done but they couldn't do any major work today because my son was so swollen and in pain they had to give him some antibiotics first and we will have to come back in a week. I got worried, I didn't want him in pain for a week! They reassure me the antibiotics will bring the swollen face down and help ease the pain with my continued doses of Ibprofens given to him. 

Needless to say by Friday we had to come back to get his infection drained. Dr. Richardson was the available doctor to do the procedure. He knew my son was very upset by this point and in pain. He was very patient and gentle. He talked to my son throughout the procedure which was assuring for him and for me. He was also concern with how swollen my sons face was. He drained the infected area but gave me his cell phone number so I can text him with pictures and updates the next day, Saturday. 

Saturday, after I sent updated text and pictures to Dr. Richardson he immediately advise us to head to the emergency room, we ended up being transported by ambulance from the emergency room to Phoenix Children's Hospital. Through out this whole ordeal Dr. Richardson stayed in contact with us and with the doctors at the hospital. I'm just very impressed with how involved Dr. Richardson was and it speaks volumes of how much he does care for his patients.

The only reason I go to this salon is to see Hayley.  I have been going to her for years and followed her from another salon where she used to work at.  The salon itself is located in a nondescript strip mall next to Name Brand Exchange.  The decor is shabby chic and very cozy feeling.

I have a 2003 Honda Accord and recently the Engine Light came on, I took it down to a local oil, lube and tire shop, Gunnel's Tires, which we frequent because of their outstanding customer service and attention to detail. Gunnel's recommended Kelly's Automotive, so we called and made an appointment to have it taken in.

My wife took the car in on a Tuesday and was at the location at 8 am sharp, ready for our "appointment" only to find out that, in the words of the attendant, "Oh, well we just had a bunch of cars come in. Can you leave it till Thursday?"

What is the point in making an appointment if the establishment you made the appointment with doesn't keep it?! I feel that Kelly's Automotive was extremely unprofessional in regards to this and I personally will not ever "try" them again. The worst part is when service-based companies have no respect for their "customers" time. AVOID these guys at all cost... Unless you want to leave your car for a week or more.
Kelly Automotive is one the best shops I have ever been to.  They honor their warrenties and provide an exceptional level of service.  I HIGHLY  recommend Kelly Automotive to anyone!!
Kelly's impresses me every time I need to go there.  The service is great and the tech's know what they are doing.  I highly recommend Kelly's to anyone.
Can't say enough good things about Kelly Automotive.  Have been bringing all of our vehicles here for years and have never had a bad experience.  Very honest and fair and always explain the options.

Some good guys at this place.  They really teach you what to do on how to get rid of bugs, and in my case, scorpions.  Get the Cy Kick CS and follow their instructions even though it is expensive.  Its the best stuff out there and takes care of everything else too.  And dont forget granules!!

Thanks guys!
More expensive than most of the sushi places in Mesa. They make the rolls look normal sized by adding extra rice using very little fish. I would not go back, very poor value.

If I could give this less then 1 star I would. They do not follow basic hygenic food prep rules. We went there and two people at the table ordered the vegetarian typpenyaki. The chef came out then promptly dumped the veggies and raw meat together. When I commented that I was a vegetarian and he was coating the veggies with the fat and blood of the meat he made a snarky comment, wiped the spatula and then promptly used it on steak before touching the veggies. I spoke to the servers and they took my plate to recook my food in the back, to then BRING ME THE SAME PLATE OF FOOD!!! I ended up getting exceptionally sick and everyone at the table was shocked at how it all played out (including 4 which were strangers). At the end the place chastised me for not telling the cook (I did and we had a conversation about it) and took 10% off the bill (not even the cost of the food I couldnt eat). I have been to dozens of japanese places in my life and never as anything like this happened. I strongly discourage anyone from going to this place.

We have been eating here for about 5 years.  It started out as excellent and has slowly desended to terrible.  Last night will be our final visit.  We sat at the (not busy) sushi bar, were greeted immediately by the sushi chef, then waited 15 to 20 minutes for someone/anyone to take our drink order.  Finally I went to the bar to get drinks.  When i arrived another patron said "good luck getting a drink here".  I was ignored by the (not that busy) bartender as he put liquor bottles away, cleaned up etc for another 10 minutes.  This bar has a history of poor service.  Whoever manages the bar should be fired.  When I returned my wife said that when I left the sushi chef notified someone that we were being ignored.  Later Erin came over, apologized for the invisible waitress and offered to take over.  The sushi was good, the sushi chefs were excellent and Erin really cared.  Unfortunately, as other Yelpers have noted, the drink and food servers mostly do not care so we will go where we are more appreciated.

Absolutely terrible food, I went for my 21 birthday party with my family and we were the only ones in the restaurant.

Lousy service and hastily cooked food, after the meal was over I was still very hungry and unsatisfied with the quality and quantity. After the bill was presented the total was  $120 my whole family and I were shocked, the food and service was awful and to expect to pay this much  was a slap in the face. Not wanting to start anything pointed out we were upset but they couldn't care less so we payed got up and left vowing never to go back again.

My husband and I were headed to a different sushi restaurant and got there too late.  I was getting hungry and angry.  We saw this place and tried it.  We were the only ones there on Thursday night after nine pm.   

We sat at the sushi bar.  I love caterpillar rolls.  It has turned into the roll that I judge a place by.  The roll here was alright.  It was good but nothing special.  The December 29th roll was delicious!  The Hubba Hubba roll was good as well.  The sushi chef was an older Asian gent who was nice.

The slight cons were we only ordered one beer and got two.  We should have spoke up since I don't drink but we didn't.  Also it was bit pricey.

We will go here again sometime.

Bummer to see poor reviews for this place, I've been coming here since I was a kid living in Gilbert and absolutely love this place! Love the experience, love the food (easily the best fried rice you will ever eat!). The filet and all of the sea food is amazing, chicken is chicken, skip it and get the fancier stuff. And the sushi is always great. Love this restaurant. I agree they could use a little sprucing up inside, but the food is delicious and I look forward to coming here every year or so!

On my boyfriends 23rd birthday we had a party of 6 arrive here. Very attentive service, owner extremely nice and the chefs very fun. Would definitely recommend Alex! And recommend sharing a meal. It is a $7 up charge but beats paying another $20+ a plate.
It's pretty good. Awesome lunch specials, clean, nice staff, no complaints. I go there regularly and haven't had any issues. Their spicy tuna is really good.

Food was delicious, show was lots of fun . Chef did the veggie toss and I caught it on my first try, my daughter was very proud.
Happy Father's Day!!

Went last weekend with a few friends and we dined at one of their Teppanyaki tables.  The waitress took forever to come to our table but, once she did, the service got better.  Ordered some sushi which came out timely and was good.  Table service by the chef was entertaining.  My scallops were very good.  He overcooked the chicken.  Wife liked her steak and shrimp.  Overall the food was good but I doubt I will ever be back.  It was sooooo hot in the restaurant that we couldn't really enjoy the evening.  I have been there three times now and it's always too hot.  Complaining to manager didn't get any results.

I was a little apprehensive at first, the soup and salad weren't great, but it was such a fun place and the food for the main course was excellent. I had shrimp that was so tender and flavorful and my husband loved his steak.  Our chef  Brandon was amazing, it was a blast to watch him flip food and the cooking utensils. I will definitely come here again.
This place, by far is my favorite place in town to eat. Hands down. I'm not saying who the best chef is. He's hard enough to get as it is. Based on extensive experience. ;)

We went for dinner on July 4.  It was not very busy.  We ordered our usual teppenyaki dish with a double serving of the fried rice.  Our table side chef seemed to be on the old side with one foot in the grave.  He was very slow and not very showmanship while the chef next to us had people laughing and involved in the show.  The food was good and we will probably come back as we like this place better than benihana.  We just will ask for a different table chef.

I am so sad, I looked forward to dinner all day after I found this east valley location earlier this week.  It is my husbands birthday so I surprised him.  What a let down.  We love Ah-So in the North Valley and thought this was related.  It SO is not...  The service was terrible, the servers were clearly overwhelmed and it all went downhill from there.  The drinks took forever, and then my order was incorrect.  When I told her, she near argued with me.  Since my husband was the only one that got his food I watched him eat- the vegetables were soft, poor quality overcooked steak and dehydrated shrimp.  He ate only because he hadnt had lunch and it was in front of him.  After 20 more minutes my food still hadnt arrived, we had enough.  Sorry but we will not be back.

Fantastic place!

Went in around 8:30 on a Saturday. Even though the restaurant was steady, the staff was attentive and friendly. We opted to sit in general dining instead of at the grills, but it was just as good. The server was polite, helpful and welcoming. 

The soup was awesome- best clear soup I've ever had, and even the salad was pleasing to my girlfriend, who doesn't like most teppanyaki/hibachi restaurants' salad dressings for being too gritty or creamy. 

The food was cooked perfectly- the rice was fried properly, it wasn't soggy or hard. The chicken was cooked thoroughly and even cooked WITH sauce, so extra wasn't necessary. My girlfriend's meal of vegetables was also cooked properly and thorough, and her steamed rice was awesome!

Definitely will visit again!

The apartments are okay. No police helicopters or take-downs here, although the cops do seem to looove pulling people over INTO the complex and blocking the gates (gee thanks).

Haven't had a bug issue, management is just fine (not too sleazy, not too perky) but these are old apartments and the management is a wee bit hard to convince if something is wrong. Our floorboards are loose as hell and our downstairs neighbors and I are worried that someone will fall through. Make sure you have them check your apartment for mold. Like I said, they are old as hell.

Don't pay for the "upgrades"= painted cupboards and fake wood flooring. The base apartments are just fine, cheap, and decent. Fireplaces and vaulted ceilings. 

Its a fine place to raise the kiddos when youre too short on cash for a house. I don't feel rotten at all for walking with my toddler through the complex at night. No worries.
